oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of selected essential oil components of Achillea millefolium agg. from the nature, organic and conventional farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rehus, Lubomir
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Content of individual essential components was evaluated of Achillea millefolium, Achillea pannonica and Achillea colina, these three species was conventionally grown, organically and collected in the wild. We can assume that in the species of Achillea grown in organic farming there could be higher contents as well as increased values in individual components of the essential oil than in conventionally grown plants.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Rehus, Lubomir (2012) Comparison of selected essential oil components of Achillea millefolium agg. from the nature, organic and conventional farming. Poster at: international scientific conference "Dendrology, floriculture and landscape gardening, Yalta, 2012.
